Ittetsu (イッテツ, Ittetsu) is a Genin of Sunagakure.
description.html: Ittetsu (イッテツ, Ittetsu) is a genin from Sunagakure.

description.text: This Kunoichi of Iwagakure was the leader of a squad that had the mission to attack Konohagakure after they were invaded and attacked by Sunagakure and Otogakure.
Iwabee Yuino (結乃イワベエ, Yuino Iwabee) is a Genin from Konohagakure. He is part of Team 5 along with Metal Lee and Denki Kaminarimon.
Iwaji (岩次, Iwaji) is a shinobi from Iwagakure who carries out missions for the village along with his two brothers Iwakyō and Iwazō.
description.html: Iwaji (岩次, Iwaji) is a shinobi from Iwagakure and along with his siblings made up the Three Brothers group.

description.text: Iwakyō (岩狂, Iwakyō) is a chunin of Iwagakure, leader of the Three Brothers of Iwa.
description.html: Iwakyō (岩狂, Iwakyō) is a shinobi from Iwagakure and the eldest brother of the village's Three Brothers group.

description.text: Iwana (ヤマメ, Iwana) was a renegade ninja from Kirigakure. who appeared in Naruto: Crossed Paths, was a member of the team Team Kajika.
description.html: Iwana (ヤマメ, Iwana) was a shinobi assisting Orochimaru that appeared in Naruto: The Cross Roads.

description.text: Iwana Akame (イワナ 赤目, Akame Iwana) is a Chūnin-level shinobi from Konoha.
description.html: Iwana Akame (赤目イワナ, Akame Iwana) is a chūnin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Iwashi Tatami with his brothers Iwakyō and Iwaji, they formed the group Three Brothers of Iwa.
Iwazō (岩造, Iwazō) es un shinobi de Iwagakure y junto con sus hermanos Iwakyō y Iwaji, formaron el grupo Tres Hermanos de Iwa.
Iyashi (イヤシ, Iyashi) is a Medical Ninja from Konohagakure.
Izumi Uchiha (うちはイズミ, Uchiha Izumi) was a member of the Uchiha Clan and childhood companion of Itachi Uchiha.
description.html: Izumi Uchiha (うちはイズミ, Uchiha Izumi) was a kunoichi from Konohagakure and a member of the Uchiha Clan. She was a friend of Itachi Uchiha since their childhood, and was infatuated with him.

description.text: Izumo Kamizuki (神月イズモ, Kamizuki Izumo) is a Chūnin from Konohagakure who spends most of his time time with his partner, Kotetsu Hagane and was part of the First Division of the Grand Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi World War.

Izuna Uchiha (うちはイズナ, Uchiha Izuna) was a shinobi of the Uchiha clan, younger brother of Madara Uchiha and son of Tajima Uchiha. Both Izuna and her brother were considered the most powerful members of the clan.
Iō (イオウ, Iō) is an inventor of weapons for his village. Along with his assistant Shōseki, he helps create some items for the people of Konohagakure to use.
He was the village chief of Bamboo Village.
description.html: Iō (イオウ, Iō) was the village head of the Bamboo Village.

description.text: Iō (イオウ, Iō) is a medical ninja from Konohagakure.
J (ジェイ, Jei) was a shinobi from Kumogakure who was killed by Taka while trying to chase them.
Jakō (邪光, Jakō) is a thief who stole treasure from a Daimyō's sister.
Jakō Ryūdōin (龙堂院邪光, Ryūdōin Jako), his brothers Rokkaku and Genshō, are introduced in the anime seeking revenge against Guy.
Jantō (ジャントウ, Jantō) is a gambler who lives in the Country of Fire.
description.html: Jantō (ジャントウ, Jantō) is a gambler from the Tanzaku Quarters.

description.text: Jibachi (ジバチ, Jibachi) appears with his brothers to search for the mysterious Bikōchū and reintegrate his clan which was in great disrepute.
Jiga (ジグ, Jiga) was one of the three brothers who attacked the Country of the Vegetables during one of the filler sagas.
Jigen (ジゲン, Jigen) was a novice monk who had his body controlled entirely by Isshiki Ōtsutsuki, functioning as his vessel
Jigumo (ジグモ, Jigumo) was a bodyguard of Orochimaru and a member of the Fūma Clan.
Jimei (ジメイ, Jimei) is one of the Konoha genin who takes the chūnin exam in the same occasion as Naruto.
description.html: Jimei (ジメイ, Jimei) is a genin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Jin Kaminari (かみなりジン, Kaminari Jin) is a Genin from Konohagakure.
description.html: Jin Kaminari (かみなりジン, Kaminari Jin) is a genin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Jinin Akebino (通草野餌人, Akebino Jinin) He was a member of the previous generation of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist of Kirigakure. He possessed the Kabutowari sword.

Jinpachi Munashi (無梨甚八, Munashi Jinpachi) was one of the members of the previous generation of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist of Kirigakure, an organization in which he possessed the sword Shibuki.

Jiraiya (自来也, Jiraiya) was one of the legendary Sannin along with Tsunade and Orochimaru, who were trained by the Third Hokage. He wrote a popular book series for adults, called ICHA ICHA, for this and among many other reasons, Naruto calls him Perverted Sage (エロ仙人, Ero-sennin). He was also known as the Toad Sage (虾蟇仙人, Gama Sennin), thanks to his summonings of toads and the ability to enter Sage Mode.
Jiryū Sendō (仙道ジリュウ, Sendō Jiryū ) He is the leader of the Sendō clan.
description.html: Jiryū Sendō (仙道ジリュウ, Sendō Jiryū) is the leader of the Sendō clan.

description.text: Jirō (ジロウ) is a genin of Konohagakure and a failed student of Kakashi Hatake.
description.html: Jirō (ジロウ, Jirō) is a Konohagakure genin and a student failed by Kakashi Hatake.

description.text: Jirōbō (次郎坊, Jirōbō) was the physically strongest member of the Sound Four and the weakest overall, according to the other members.
Jirōchō Wasabi (ワサビ次郎長, Wasabi Jirōchō) is the head of the Wasabi family in Tea Country, which is a clan at war with the Wagarashi family.
description.html: Jirōchō Wasabi (ワサビ次郎長, Wasabi Jirōchō) is the head of the Wasabi family in the Land of Tea, which is a clan warring with the nearby Wagarashi family.

description.text: JJ (ジェイ・ジェイ, Jei Jei) is a Student of the Konohagakure Academy. Lock is an elderly leader of the Lock Village. , Jūgo) or Jūgo of the Scales (天秤の重吾, Tenpin no Jūgo) is a ninja from a mysterious clan and the origin of Orochimaru's cursed seal, he decided to go with the Sannin voluntarily to avoid harming more people due to not knowing how to control his power and was imprisoned until Sasuke Uchiha defeated Orochimaru and freed him; He later joined Taka, being the third and last member to join the team. and former owner of the Kubikiribōchō sword. In the anime, he was a member of Akatsuki, being the partner of Itachi Uchiha.
description.html: JJ (ジェイ・ジェイ, Jei Jei) is a citizen of Konohagakure.

description.text: Junsai (蓴菜, Junsai) fue un Jōnin de Kirigakure que participó en la Tragedia del Paso de Yosuga.
description.html: Junsai was a shinobi of Kirigakure.

description.text: El Jefe de la Aldea de la Cerradura es un anciano líder de la Aldea de la Cerradura.
Jōseki (ジョウセキ, Jōseki) es uno de los altos rangos del Consejo de Suna.
description.html: Jōseki (ジョウセキ, Jōseki) is a Senior from Sunagakure.

description.text: Jūgo (重吾, Jūgo) o Jūgo de las Escalas (天秤の重吾, Tenpin no Jūgo) es un ninja de un misterioso clan y el origen del sello maldito de Orochimaru, decidió ir con el Sannin voluntariamente para evitar dañar a más personas debido al no saber controlar su poder y estuvo recluso hasta que Sasuke Uchiha derrotó a Orochimaru y lo liberó; posteriormente se unió a Taka, siendo el tercer y último miembro en entrar al equipo.

Jūzō Biwa (枇杷十蔵, Biwa Jūzō) fue un jōnin de Kirigakure, miembro de los Siete Espadachines Ninja de la Niebla y antiguo dueño de la espada Kubikiribōchō. En el anime, fue un miembro de Akatsuki, siendo el compañero de Itachi Uchiha.
K (ケー, Kē) is a chūnin of Kumogakure and was a partner of J.
description.html: K (ケー, Kē) is a chūnin of Kumogakure and was partnered with J.

description.text: Kabure Tokisuki (時好カブレ, Tokisuki Kabure) is a shinobi of Konohagakure, of Chūnin rank.
description.html: Kabure Tokisuki (時好カブレ, Tokisuki Kabure) is a chūnin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kabuto Yakushi (薬師カブト, Yakushi Kabuto) was one of the antagonists of the series and is Orochimaru's former personal physician, right-hand man and assistant. During the Fourth Shinobi World War he became an invaluable asset against the Grand Shinobi Alliance thanks to his revived shinobi. Years after the Fourth Shinobi World War, Kabuto along with Urushi take charge of the Fire Country Orphanage.
This Jonin was the leader of Team Kabuto and took them to the Chūnin Exams.
description.html: He is a Konohagakure jōnin and the leader of Team Kabuto.

description.text: Kaede (カエデ, Kaede) is a kunoichi from Konohagakure.
description.html: Kaede (カエデ, Kaede) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kaede Yoshino (嬉野カエデ, Yoshino Kaede) is a young inhabitant of Konohagakure.
description.html: Kaede Yoshino (嬉野カエデ, Yoshino Kaede) is a former academy student of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kagami Uchiha (うちはカガミ, Uchiha Kagami) was a Jōnin of Konohagakure and a member of the Uchiha Clan.
description.html: Kagami Uchiha (うちはカガミ, Uchiha Kagami) was a jōnin from Konohagakure's Uchiha clan.

description.text: Kagari (篝, Kagari) is a Genin of Amegakure and one of the members of Team Oboro.
Kage (影, Kage) is an Anbu from Konohagakure.
Kageki (歌劇, Kageki) is Katazu's younger twin brother and the man who accidentally killed Shikazō.
description.html: Kageki (歌劇, Kageki) is the twin brother of Katazu and the man who accidentally killed Shikazo.

description.text: Kagen Uchiha (うちはカゲン, Uchiha Kagen) was an inhabitant of Konohagakure belonging to the Uchiha clan and a member of the Konoha Military Police.
description.html: Kagen Uchiha (うちはカゲン, Uchiha Kagen) was a member of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan.

description.text: Kagerō Fūma (カゲロウ, Fūma Kagerō) was a member of the Fūma Clan. She was among the members of the Fūma clan who were deceived by Orochimaru. She was a kunoichi of a three-member group (along with Jigumo and Kamikiri) who sought out Orochimaru to restore their clan.

Kagura (カグラ, Kagura) was an original character created specifically for the story. from Naruto: Clash of Ninja Revolution 2. He returned as a playable character once again for its sequel, Naruto Shippūden: Clash of Ninja Revolution 3. He was a former ANBU member who had wanted to become Tsunade's apprentice, and later, the Hokage , but was mischievous when Tsunade refused, though only due to Kagura's lack of compassion.

Kagura Karatachi (枸橘かぐら, Karatachi Kagura) was a Kirigakure shinobi who worked as Chōjūrō's assistant. the Sixth Mizukage. He was a candidate for the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist and was part of the New: Seven Ninja Swordsmen.
He was the head of the Kaguya Clan, and father of Kimimaro.
description.html: He was the head of the Kaguya clan.

description.text: Kaguya Ōtsutsuki (大筒木カグヤ, Ōtsutsuki Kaguya) was the matriarch of the Ōtsutsuki Clan and the mother of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki and Hamura Ōtsutsuki. She was the first being to learn, control and use the Chakra, because she consumed the fruit of the God Tree, with which she was able to stop the wars that were in the world. Additionally, she was part of the creation of a Ten Tails. She was revived during the Fourth Shinobi World War thanks to her creation Black Zetsu.
Kahiko (カヒコ, Kahiko) is an old man who leads a traveling caravan, he is a descendant of the Gelel House of Miners.

Kahyō (華氷, Kahyō) is a renegade ninja from Kirigakure and the bodyguard of the leader of the Ryūha Armament Alliance, Garyō. After failing in her mission and seeing the errors of her decisions, she decided to take the position of mistress of Hōzukijō for life.
Kaiza (カイザ, Kaiza) was a fisherman who arrived in the Land of Waves trying their luck.
description.html: Kaiza (カイザ, Kaiza) was a travelling fisherman who came to the Land of Waves to seek new opportunity.

description.text: Kaji (カジ, Kaji) is a boatman from the Land of Waves.
description.html: Kaji (カジ, Kaji) is a citizen of the Land of Waves.

description.text: Kajika (カジカ, Kajika) was a missing-nin of Kirigakure that appears in the fifth Naruto OVA, Naruto: Crossed Paths. He was a member of Team Kajika.
Kajūra (カジュウラ, Kajūra) is a Jōnin-level terrorist from Ishigakure, arrested by Sunagakure forces.

Kakashi Hatake (はたけカカシ, Hatake Kakashi) is a shinobi from Konohagakure. He was a Jōnin, ex-ANBU, and the leader of Team 7. He was known worldwide for his use of the Sharingan, which earned him the nickname Kakashi the Copy Ninja (コピー忍者のカカシ, Kopi Ninja no Kakashi) and Kakashi of the Sharingan. (写輪眼のカカシ, Sharingan no Kakashi). In his adolescence he was a student of Minato Namikaze and a teammate of Obito Uchiha and Rin Nohara. He was also the captain of the Third Division of the Great Shinobi Alliance. After the events of the Fourth Shinobi World War, Kakashi became the Sixth Hokage (六代目火影, Rokudaime Hokage; meaning 'Sixth Shadow of Fire') of Konoha.
Kakeru Tsuki (ツキカケル, Tsuki Kakeru) was the father of Michiru Tsuki and the grandfather of Hikaru Tsuki.
description.html: Kakeru Tsuki (ツキカケル, Tsuki Kakeru) was the father of Michiru and the grandfather of Hikaru Tsuki.

description.text: Kakkō (カッコウ, Kakkō) was a shinobi from Iwagakure who participated in the Third Shinobi World War.
Kakoi (カコイ, Kakoi) is a member of the Konoha Barrier Team.

Kakuzu (角都, Kakuzu) was a renegade ninja from Takigakure and a member of Akatsuki. His partner was Hidan. He wore the 'North' ring (北, Hoku) on his left middle finger. Despite their mutual dislike, their teamwork was almost perfect, because they complemented each other. Kisame Hoshigaki refers to Hidan and Kakuzu as the 'Zombie Combo' (ゾンビコンビ, Zonbi Konbi), since they practically could not die.
This shinobi was a missing ninja from an unknown village and a member of Akatsuki, who was associated with Kakuzu.
description.html: This shinobi was a missing-nin from an unknown village and a member of Akatsuki, who was partnered with Kakuzu.

description.text: Kakō (力コウ, Kakō) was one of the Fabricated who was under Kū.
Kamakiri Ikeno (池乃カマキリ, Ikeno Kamakiri) is a shinobi from Kirigakure.
Kamatari (カマタリ, Kamatari) is a weasel that carries a scythe, it is Temari's personal summon.
Kamikiri Fūma (カミキリ, Fūma Kamikiri) was a bodyguard of Orochimaru and a member of the Fūma Clan.
Kamira (カミラ, Kamira) served as one of the Knights of Haido.
Kanabun (カナブン, Kanabun) is the leader of the Kanabun Gang.
description.html: Kanabun (カナブン, Kanabun) is the leader of the Kanabun Gang.

description.text: Kandachi (カンダチ, Kandachi), is a renegade ninja from the Village Hidden in the Rain who was the right-hand man of Hanzō.

Kankurō (カンクロウ, Kankurō) is a Sunagakure shinobi specialized in puppets, second son of the Fourth Kazekage, younger brother of Temari and older brother of Gaara, the Fifth Kazekage. He belongs to Baki's team and is the leader of the Surprise Attack Division of the Grand Shinobi Alliance.
Kanna (カンナ, Kanna) was an inhabitant of a village visited by Asura Ōtsutsuki, eventually would become his wife.
Kanna (カンナ, Kanna) is a citizen of Konohagakure and also the current Master Carpenter.
description.html: Kanna (カンナ, Kanna) is a citizen of Konohagakure as well as the current Master Carpenter.

description.text: Kanoe (庚) is a former member of the Anbu Root faction of Konohagakure.
Kanoto (辛) is a former member of the Anbu Root faction of Konohagakure.
Kanpu (カンプ, Kanpu) is one of the adults who are in charge of the Fire Country Orphanage.
description.html: Kanpu (カンプ, Kanpu) is a caretaker at an orphanage located on the outskirts of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kanpō (カンポウ, Kanpō) is a Medical Ninja from Konohagakure.
description.html: Kanpō (カンポウ, Kanpō) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kanyū (漢入) was a ceramist from Ceramic Village.
description.html: Kanyū (漢入) was a ceramist of Ceramic Village.

description.text: Kaori (カオリ, Kaori) is a nurse from Konohagakure.
description.html: Kaori (カオリ, Kaori) is a Konohagakure citizen, and a nurse at the Konoha Hospital.

description.text: Karai (カライ, Karai), is a shinobi from Kumogakure.
Karashi (カラシ, Karashi) is the son of Sanshō, and heir to his curry shop.
description.html: Karashi (カラシ, Karashi) is Sanshō's son, and heir to her Curry of Life Shop.

description.text: Karenbana (カレンバナ, Karenbana) was the only kunoichi member of the Three Wandering Ninjas alongside her companions Ishidate and Kongō, hired by Shabadaba to assassinate the king of the Country of the Moon.

Karin (香燐, Karin) is a subordinate of Orochimaru and a former kunoichi of Kusagakure, belonging to the Uzumaki Clan, who traveled with Sasuke Uchiha aiding him in his revenge. She assisted Orochimaru in his experiments and was left in charge of the Southern Lair while he was away.
Karin Kagura (神楽かりん, Kagura Karin) is the owner from a ninja weapons shop known as 'Emporium Karin' located in Konohagakure.
description.html: Karin Kagura (神楽かりん, Kagura Karin) is the owner of a ninja weapon shop known as "Emporium Karin" located in Konohagakure.

description.text: Karin's Mother was a member of the Uzumaki Clan and Karin's mother, as well as a former resident of Kusagakure

Karui (カルイ, Karui), whose current name is Karui Akimichi (秋道カルイ, Akimichi Karui), is a Kumogakure kunoichi, Killer B's apprentice, and a member of Team Samui. She was part of the Second Division in the Fourth Shinobi World War. She currently lives in Konohagakure as the wife of Chōji Akimichi and mother of Chōchō Akimichi.
Karura (加琉羅, Karura) was the wife of Rasa and the mother of Temari, Gaara and Kankurō.
description.html: Karura (加流羅, Karura) was the wife of Sunagakure's Fourth Kazekage: Rasa.

description.text: Karyū (カリュウ, Karyū) was the leader of the Dark Thunder Group. He met Sasuke Uchiha during his redemption trip around the world. In the anime, he was a member of the Lightning Group and Fūshin's subordinate.
Kashike (カシケ, Kashike) was a student at Sunagakure Academy.
description.html: Kashike (カシケ, Kashike) is a former academy student of Sunagakure.

description.text: Kasuga Nara (奈良カスガ, Nara Kasuga) is a shinobi from Konohagakure, a member of the Nara Clan. She was part of the Great Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Kasumi (カスミ, Kasumi) is a student at Konoha Academy.
description.html: Kasumi (カスミ, Kasumi) is a former academy student of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kasumi (かすみ, Kasumi) or Dusk Princess (キリ姫, Kiri-hime), is the princess of Dusk Castle who appears in Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Heroes 2: The Phantom Fortress. She also has a cameo in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja 5 and Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2.
Katasuke Tōno (遠野カタスケ, Tōno Katasuke) is a shinobi from Konohagakure who is part of Team Ninja Scientific Tools.
Katazu (カタズ, Katazu) is a swordsman who pretended to be his brother after Shikazo's death.
Katsura (カツラ) was a friend of Tenma Izumo during his stay at Konohagakure Academy.
description.html: Katsura (カツラ, Katsura) was a friend of Tenma Izumo during their time in Konohagakure's Academy.

description.text: Katsuyu (カツユ, Katsuyu) is one of the slugs that resides in the Shikkōtsu Forest and is the personal summon of Tsunade and Sakura Haruno.

Kawaki (カワキ, Kawaki) is a Genin affiliated with Konohagakure. He is a mysterious young man and the key to fulfilling the Kara organization's greatest wish. He was adopted by the Seventh Hokage as another son.
Kawarama Senju (千手瓦间, Senju Kawarama) was a young member of the Forest Senju Clan. He was the brother of Hashirama Senju, Itama Senju and Tobirama Senju.
description.html: Kawarama Senju (千手瓦間, Senju Kawarama) was a young shinobi from the Senju clan.

description.text: Kaya (カヤ, Kaya) was an inhabitant of a village in Jiraiya's novel during Tsunade's Infinite Tsukuyomi dream.
description.html: Kaya (カヤ, Kaya) was a character from Jiraiya's novel, who appeared in Tsunade's Infinite Tsukuyomi dream.

description.text: Kayo (加代, Kayo) Princess Kayo (加代姫, Kayo-hime) is the wife of the daimyō of the Land of Honey.
description.html: Kayo (加代, Kayo) is the wife of the daimyō of the Land of Honey. She originated from the Land of Bean Jam.

description.text: Kayui (カユイ, Kayui) is a shinobi who belongs to Kumogakure.
description.html: Kayui (カユイ, Kayui) is a shinobi of Kumogakure.

description.text: Kazabune (カザブネ, Kazabune) is a street vendor who sells water balloons and other toys.
description.html: Kazabune (カザブネ, Kazabune) is a travelling salesman who deals in water balloons and other toys.

description.text: Kazami (カザミ, Kazami) is a Genin from Kusagakure, who teams with Muyami and Burami.

Kazan (カザン, Kazan) appeared in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison, and was a ninja from Yugakure who was hired by Mui to help him frame Naruto Uzumaki. He was known as 'Kazan of Hundred Transformations' (百変化のカザン, Hyaku Henge no Kazan) due to his great skill with the Transformation Technique.

Kazuma (カズマ, Kazuma), also known as Furido (フリド, Furido), he was a member of the Twelve Ninja Guardians of the Fire Country and eventually led half of the group to organize a coup against the Hokage. He was also Sora's father, as well as the main anime antagonist in the Twelve Ninja Guardians (Saga)
Kegon (ケゴン, Kegon) is a Jōnin of Takigakure.
Keiri (ケイリ, Keiri) is one of the adults in charge of the Fire Country Orphanage.
description.html: Keiri (ケイリ, Keiri) is a caretaker at an orphanage located on the outskirts of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kiba Inuzuka (犬塚キバ, Inuzuka Kiba) is a Jōnin-ranked shinobi from Konohagakure belonging to the Inuzuka Clan. He is part of Team Kurenai, along with his teammates Hinata Hyūga and Shino Aburame, and was part of the Fifth Division of the Grand Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Kido Tsumiki (積木キド, Tsumiki Kido) is an ANBU executive from Konohagakure, formerly a high-ranking member of Root.
Kidōmaru (鬼童丸 Kidōmaru) was a member of the Sound Four and according to Orochimaru, he was the smartest of the group.
Kie (掃依, Kie) was a shinobi of Amegakure and one of the original members of Akatsuki.
Kigiri (鬼霧, Kigiri ) was a prisoner of Orochimaru and was part of the Guren Team that had the mission to capture the Sanbi.
Kihō (鬼鳳) was a prisoner of Orochimaru who was a member of the Guren Team tasked with capturing the Sanbi.
Kiiro (キイロ) was an independent shinobi.
Kiji (キジ, Kiji) is a Genin-level shinobi from Benisu Island.
description.html: Kiji (キジ, Kiji) is a genin from the Benisu Island.

description.text: Kiki (キキ, Kiki) is a monkey and a trained circus animal.
description.html: Kiki (キキ, Kiki) is a monkey and a trained circus animal.

description.text: Kikunojō (菊之丞, Kikunojō) was an expert ninja from the Land of Vegetables and Haruna's bodyguard.
Killer B (キラービー, Kirabi) is a shinobi from Kumogakure. and last Jinchūriki of Gyūki. He is the adopted younger brother of the Fourth Raikage and adopted son of the Third Raikage.

Kimimaro (君麻呂, Kimimaro) was the fifth member and leader of the Sound Four. Being the reason why they changed their group name to Sound Five. He was the only survivor of the destruction of the Kaguya Clan, and also the last to adopt the Kekkei Genkai, Shikotsumyaku, which is why he became a great Ninja under the orders of Orochimaru. He was also resurrected by Kabuto Yakushi for the Fourth Shinobi World War.

Kin (キン, Kin) appears in Naruto the Movie: The Rescue of the Snow Princess!. He is the actor who plays the popular Brit in the movie 'Princess Gale'. In the film, Michy, Kin and Hidero summon their Rainbow Chakra to defeat the armored warriors and their je

Kin Tsuchi (キン・ツチ, Kin Tsuchi) was a Genin-level kunoichi from Otogakure . She participated in the Chūnin Exams under Orochimaru's orders to kill Sasuke Uchiha. She was the only one of her team not to have a physical alteration.
Kina Kodon (虎呑キナ, Kodon Kina) is a young member of the Kodon clan.
description.html: Kina Kodon (虎呑キナ, Kodon Kina) is a young member of the Kodon clan.

description.text: King (キング, Kingu) is a giant gorilla residing on the island of Genbu and the strongest of the animals. This one is called by Killer B as King-chan (キングちゃん, Kingu-chan) out of affection.
description.html: King (キング, Kingu) is a giant gorilla that lives on Genbu. Killer B calls him King-chan (キングちゃん, Kingu-chan), as a sign of affection.

description.text: The King of Hell (冥府の王, Meifu no Ō) is a being who can use a wielder of the Rinnegan. This figure, like the invocations of the Animal Path, possesses the Rinnegan, allowing him to see through it.
description.html: The King of Hell (冥府の王, Meifu no Ō) is a being that is used by a wielder of the Rinnegan. This figure, like the Animal Path's summons, possesses Rinnegan eyes, allowing a Rinnegan wielder to see through its eyes.[2]

description.text: Kinkaku (金角, Kinkaku) was, along with his brother Ginkaku, one of the legendary Gold and Silver Brothers of Kumogakure.
Kinoto (乙, Kinoto) is an ANBU from Konohagakure who was under Danzō Shimura in the secret organization Root.
Kinshiki Ōtsutsuki (大筒木キンシキ, Ōtsutsuki Kinshiki) was a member of the main family of the Ōtsutsuki Clan, who served as the father figure and obedient subordinate of Momoshiki Ōtsutsuki.
Kintoki (キントキ, Kintoki) is a giant bear who lives on Turtle Island in the Lightning Country.
description.html: Kintoki (キントキ, Kintoki) is a giant bear that lives on Genbu.

description.text: Kirara (キララ, Kirara) was one of the Made who was under the orders of Kū and led Akuta to fulfill Ōnoki's wish to protect peace within Iwagakure and the shinobi world.
description.html: Kirara (キララ, Kirara) was a fabrication, that was created to serve Kū and to lead the Akuta in order to fulfil Ōnoki's desire to protect peace within Iwagakure and the shinobi world.

description.text: Kiri (キリ, Kiri) is a medical ninja from Kirigakure.
Kiri (伎璃, Kiri) is the head of a village of peasants located on the borders of the Country of Fire and Wind, known as Green Rice.
description.html: Kiri (伎璃, Kiri) is the village head of Green Banks.

description.text: Kirisame (霧雨, Kirisame) is a renegade ninja from Amegakure who appeared in the ova Mission: Protect the Waterfall Village!.
Kiruru (キルル) was a genin of Kirigakure.
description.html: Kiruru (キルル, Kiruru) was a genin of Kirigakure.

description.text: Kisame Hoshigaki (干柿鬼鮫 Hoshigaki Kisame), known as the Monster of the Hidden Mist (霧隠れの怪人, Kirigakure no Kaijin), was a renegade ninja from Kirigakure, former member of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist and previously Itachi Uchiha's partner in Akatsuki. He wore the South Ring (南, Nan) on his left ring finger.
Kisuke Maboroshi (まぼろし奇介, Maboroshi Kisuke) was an ANBU member of Konohagakure.
description.html: Kisuke Maboroshi (まぼろし奇介, Maboroshi Kisuke) was a member of Konohagakure's Anbu.

description.text: Kisuke's Wife was a Konoha villager and the wife of Kisuke Maboroshi.
description.html: Kisuke's Wife was a villager of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kitane (キタネ, Kitane) was once a member of The 12 Ninja Guardians. It seems that he was a friend of Asuma Sarutobi before his death.
Kitsuchi (黄ツチ, Kitsuchi) is a ninja from Iwagakure and Kurotsuchi's father and is the captain of the Second Division of the Shinobi Alliance .
Kitō (キトウ, Kitō) is a medical ninja from Konohagakure.
Kiyoi Yotsuki (夜月キヨイ, Yotsuki Kiyoi) is a ninja from Kumogakure who is a member of the Yotsuki Clan.
description.html: Kiyoi Yotsuki (夜月キヨイ, Yotsuki Kiyoi) is a shinobi from Kumogakure and a member of the Yotsuki clan.

description.text: Kiyomu Fukuda (Fukuda Kiyomu) is a ninja from Konohagakure.
description.html: Kiyomu Fukuda (Fukuda Kiyomu) is a ninja from Konohagakure.

description.text: Kiyoyasu Kagetsu is a member of the Kagetsu Family.
Kizashi Haruno (春野キザシ, Haruno Kizashi) is the father of Sakura Haruno, husband of Mebuki Haruno and the Fourth Hokage in the film Road to Ninja: Naruto the Movie, replacing Minato Namikaze.
description.html: Kizashi Haruno (春野キザシ, Haruno Kizashi) is a shinobi of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kobushi Saiki (砕気コブシ, Saiki Kobushi) is a shinobi of Kumogakure.
description.html: Kobushi Saiki (砕気コブシ, Saiki Kobushi) is a shinobi from Kumogakure.

description.text: Kodaka (コダカ) was an independent shinobi.
Kohada (コハダ, Kohada) is an assistant at a sushi shop in Konohagakure.
Kohari Umino (うみのコハリ, Umino Kohari) was the mother of Iruka Umino and was a Kunoichi of Konohagakure who was seriously injured and died during the Nine-Tails' Attack on Konoha.
description.html: Kohari Umino (うみのコハリ, Umino Kohari) was a kunoichi from Konohagakure.

description.text: Koharu Utatane (うたたねコハル, Utatane Koharu) is a former member of Team Tobirama, along with Hiruzen Sarutobi and Homura Mitokado. He currently forms, along with Homura, the Konoha Council.

Koji Kashin (果心居士, Kashin Koji) is a clone of Jiraiya created by Amado. He was one of the 'Internals' (内陣インナー, Innā) of the Kara organization, being in charge of the surroundings of the Country of Fire.
Kokage Yanagikage (柳陰コカゲ, Yanagikage Kokage) is a Chūnin of Konohagakure.
Kokuyō (コクヨウ) was an invention, who was created to serve Kū and lead the Akuta to fulfill Ōnoki's wish to protect peace within Iwagakure and the shinobi world.
Kokuyō (コクヨウ, Kokuyō) is a ninja who violently sought Shizuka's hand in marriage, although she rejected him because she wanted to conquer the Nadeshiko village.

Kokuō (穆王, Kokuō), known as the Five-Tails (五尾, Gobi) is a Tailed Beast shaped like a horse and dolphin, sealed in Han of Iwagakure. He was captured, extracted, and sealed by Akatsuki. In the anime, the Five-Tails is one of the first two tailed beasts that Akatsuki captured before the start of Part II. He was then freed by the Great Shinobi Alliance, however, he was re-captured by Madara Uchiha. She is currently free after the defeat and subsequent sealing of Kaguya.

Komachi (小町, Komachi) is an ANBU who only appears as an exclusive character in the video game Naruto: Clash of Ninja Revolution 2. Likewise, he appears in Naruto Shippūden: Clash of Ninja Revolution 3.
Komame (コマメ, Komame) is the head of the Konohagakure Post Office.
description.html: Komame (コマメ, Komame) is the bureau chief of Konohagakure's Central Post Office.

description.text: Komaza (コマザ, Komaza) is a genin from Sunagakure who did not make it to the first phase of the Chūnin Exams in Konohagakure.
description.html: Komaza (コマザ, Komaza) is a genin from Sunagakure.

description.text: Komichi (コミチ, Komichi) was a villager in Jiraiya's novel during Tsunade's dream of Infinite Tsukuyomi.
description.html: Komichi (コミチ, Komichi) was a character from Jiraiya's novel, who appeared in Tsunade's Infinite Tsukuyomi dream.

description.text: Komitsu (コミツ) is Ōmitsu's younger brother.
description.html: Komitsu (コミツ) is the younger brother of Ōmitsu.

description.text: Komori is a member of the Enlightened Ones.
description.html: Komori is a member of the Enlightened Ones.

description.text: Komugi (コムギ, Komugi) is a Genin of Konoha who participated in the Chūnin Exams.
description.html: Komugi (コムギ, Komugi) is a genin from Konohagakure.

description.text: Komushi (コムシ, Komushi) was a shinobi from Sunagakure and companion of Sasori in his youth. He was turned into a human puppet by Sasori after his death.

Konan (小南, Konan) was a kunoichi of Amegakure and the only female member of Akatsuki. She wore the 'White' (白, Bya) ring on her right middle finger. After Nagato's death, she defected from the organization and became the leader of Amegakure. She possessed a natural talent for origami.
Konenmaru was one of Suien's summons in Naruto: Mission: Protect the Waterfall Village! (novel).
description.html: Konenmaru was one of Suien's summoning animals in Naruto: Mission: Protect The Waterfall Village! (novel).

description.text: Kongō (コンゴウ, Kongō) was one of the Three Wandering Ninjas hired by Shabadaba to overthrow the king of the Country of the Moon, Kakeru Tsuki.
description.html: Kongō (コンゴウ, Kongō) was a member of the Wandering Ninja Clan in the Land of the Moon.

description.text: The Astronomer of Konoha is a kunoichi of Konohagakure and the assistant of the Sixth Hokage Kakashi Hatake.

Konohamaru Sarutobi (猿飛木ノ葉丸, Sarutobi Konohamaru) is a jōnin of Konohagakure, grandson of the Third Hokage During his time as a genin he was a member of Team Ebisu along with Moegi and Udon. He is currently the leader of Team Konohamaru, composed of Boruto, Sarada and Mitsuki.
Kontsuchi (紺ツチ, Kontsuchi) is a inhabitant of Iwagakure.
description.html: Kontsuchi (紺ツチ, Kontsuchi) is a citizen of Iwagakure.

description.text: Korega (コ再ガイン, Korega) was the military captain of the Land of the Moon.
Korobi (コロビ, Korobi) is a ninja of Sunagakure.
Koshō (こしょう, Koshō) is a Genin of Konohagakure. She teamed up with Sato and Shio
description.html: Koshō (こしょう, Koshō) is a genin of Konohagakure, forming a team with Satō and Shio.

description.text: Kosuke (小助, Kosuke) was an ANBU of Kirigakure who fought in the Third Shinobi World War.
Kosuke Maruboshi (まるぼしコスケ, Maruboshi Kosuke) is a Genin of Konoha, who was nicknamed 'The Eternal Genin' by other ninjas (万年下忍, Mannen Genin).

Kotetsu Hagane (はがねコテツ, Hagane Kotetsu) is a chūnin-ranked ninja from Konohagakure, who spends most of his time with his partner and best friend, Izumo. Kamizuki. He is the assistant of the Fifth Hokage and is part of the First Division in the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Kotohime (琴姫, Kotohime) is a kunoichi of the Fūma Clan who joined Orochimaru alongside Arashi, Jigumo, Kagerō and Kamikiri when the clan fell on hard times.
Koyuki Kazahana (风花小雪, Kazahana Koyuki) is a famous actress, mainly known for playing the princess 'Yukie Fujikaze' (富士風雪絵, Fujikaze Yukie).
Kozuchi (コヅチ, Kozuchi) was a resident of Iwagakure and the grandson of Ōnoki.
description.html: Kozuchi (コヅチ, Kozuchi) was a citizen of Iwagakure.

description.text: Kujaku (孔雀, Kujaku) was a ninja from Takumi Village, in turn the only female member of the Four Men of the Celestial Symbols team
Kumade Toriichi (酉市クマデ, Toriichi Kumade) was a ninja from Konoha who was killed by Zabuza Momochi using a combination of his Silent Killing jutsu and Hidden Mist Techniques at some point in the past.
description.html: Kumade Toriichi (酉市クマデ, Toriichi Kumade) was a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kumadori (クマドリ, Kumadori) is a Medical Ninja and researcher from Konohagakure.
description.html: Kumadori (クマドリ, Kumadori) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure and Shizune's junior. He is also a member of the village's Analysis Team in the Intelligence Division.

description.text: Kunihisa (クニヒサ, Kunihisa) is a boy from a rich family in the Fire Country.
description.html: Kunihisa (クニヒサ, Kunihisa) is the spoiled son of rich jeweller Kunijirō.

description.text: Kunijirō is Kunihisa's father, and he is a very wealthy man.
description.html: Kunijirō (クニジロウ, Kunijirō) is a rich jeweller who started off poor and is an old acquaintance of Tsunade.

description.text: Kunugi Mokume (木目クヌギ, Mokume Kunugi) is a jōnin-level shinobi from Konohagakure.
description.html: Kunugi Mokume (木目クヌギ, Mokume Kunugi) is a jōnin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kurama (九喇嘛, Kurama), also known as the Nine-Tails (九尾, Kyūbi) was a Tailed Beast that was sealed inside Naruto Uzumaki. being considered the most powerful of the nine beasts created by the Sage of the Six Paths. Although for most of the series, Kurama's chakra was divided into two parts, the Yin half and the Yang half, they were eventually unified within Naruto after the events of the Fourth Shinobi World War and remained in their original state. interior until his death from the effects of Baryon Mode.

Kurenai Yūhi (夕日紅, Yūhi Kurenai) whose current name is Kurenai Sarutobi (猿飛紅, Sarutobi Kurenai), is a Jōnin of Konoha in charge of Team 8, consisting of Kiba Inuzuka, Shino Aburame, and Hinata Hyūga. Kurenai's team specializes in tracking and she herself is a talented genjutsu specialist.
Kurobachi (クロバチ, Kurobachi) was a ninja of the Kamizuru Clan.
Kuroma Tatsuhiro (龍代クロマ, Tatsushiro Kuroma) is the antagonist of the video game Naruto Shippūden: Dragon Blade Chronicles.
Kuromaru (黒丸) is the canine companion of Tsume Inuzuka, the mother of Kiba Inuzuka .
Kurotsuchi (黒ツチ, Kurotsuchi) is the Fourth Tsuchikage (四代目土影, Yondaime Tsuchikage; literally 'Fourth Shadow of the Earth') of Iwagakure. She is the granddaughter of the Third Tsuchikage, Ōnoki.
Kurozuka (クロヅカ, Kurozuka) was an ANBU from the Soto Country, and a member of the Prajñā Group.
description.html: Kurozuka (クロヅカ, Kurozuka) was an Anbu and one of the last remaining members of the Land of Woods' Prajñā Group.

description.text: Kusabi (クサビ, Kusabi) was one of Gatō's many thugs.
description.html: Kusabi (クサビ, Kusabi) is one of the many mercenaries hired by Gatō.

description.text: Kushimaru Kuriarare (栗霰串丸, Kuriarare Kushimaru) was one of the members of the previous generation of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. Kirigakure, being the wielder of the Nuibari sword.

Kushina Uzumaki (うずまきクシナ, Uzumaki Kushina) was the mother of Naruto Uzumaki and the wife of the Fourth Hokage Minato Namikaze. She was a kunoichi belonging to the Uzumaki Clan of Uzushiogakure and was the second Jinchūriki of Kurama.
Kussaku (クッサク, Kussaku) was a shinobi of Kirigakure, who was part of the Sensor Division of the Great Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Kusuma (クスマ, Kusuma) is a vendor from the Country of Fire who sells masks in the Tanzaku village, many of which resemble ANBU masks or anime and manga characters.
description.html: Kusuma (クスマ, Kusuma) is a citizen of the Land of Fire and sells masks in Tanzaku Quarters.

description.text: Kusuna (クスナ, Kusuna) was a ninja who came from the Country of Demons. Which only appeared in the film Naruto Shippūden: The Movie.
Kusune (クスネ, Kusune) was a ninja who possessed one of Iō's ninja weapons, the Tsuru-Kame shield.
Kusushi (クスシ, Kusushi) is a Medical Ninja of Konohagakure.
Kuwa Yokohori (横堀クワ, Yokohori Kuwa) is an inhabitant of Konohagakure.
description.html: Kuwa Yokohori (横堀クワ, Yokohori Kuwa) is a citizen of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kyodaigumo (巨大蜘蛛, Kyodaigumo) is a giant spider and the personal summoning of Kidōmaru.
Kyohō Fuefuki (笛吹巨峰, Fuefuki Kyohō) is a shinobi of Kirigakure and one of the New: Seven Ninja Swordsmen.
Kyōya (キョウヤ, Kyōya) along with Ginji were Kakuzu's bankers and a member of Akatsuki.
description.html: Kyōya (キョウヤ, Kyōya) is an accountant of Kakuzu, a member of the Akatsuki.

description.text: Kyūroku Wagarashi (ワガラシ九六, Wagarashi Kyūroku) is the head of the Wagarashi family in the Land of Tea, which is a clan at war with the Wasabi family.
description.html: Kyūroku Wagarashi (ワガラシ九六, Wagarashi Kyūroku) is the head of the Wagarashi family in the Land of Tea, which is a clan warring with the nearby Wasabi family.

description.text: Kyūsuke(鳩助, Kyūsuke) was a former shinobi of Amegakure who decided to join Akatsuki as one of its members. founders.
Kō (コウ) was an Anbu of Konohagakure.
description.html: Kō (コウ) was an Anbu of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kō Hyūga (日向コウ, Hyūga Kō) is a Konoha shinobi and a member of the main branch of the Hyūga clan
description.html: Kō Hyūga (日向コウ, Hyūga Kō) is a shinobi from the main house of Konohagakure's Hyūga clan.[1]

description.text: Kōji (コウジ, Kōji) was a student at the Konoha Ninja Academy.
description.html: Kōji (コウジ, Kōji) is a former academy student of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kōji (コウジ, Kōji) is a genin from Sunagakure who participated in the Chūnin Exams alongside Ameno and Shishio.
Kōmei (红明, Kōmei) is a strategist from the Land of Birds and a candidate for the position of Daimyō.
Kōsuke (コウスケ, Kōsuke) was a messenger toad from Myōboku Mountain.
description.html: Kōsuke (コウスケ, Kōsuke) was a messenger toad from Mount Myōboku.

description.text: Kōsuke (コウスケ, Kōsuke) is a scientist in the Konoha Ninja Scientific Tool Team.
description.html: Kōsuke (コウスケ, Kōsuke) is a scientist who works for Konohagakure's Scientific Ninja Weapons Team.

description.text: Kōta (コウタ, Kōta) was a student at the Konohagakure Ninja Academy. .
description.html: Kōta (コウタ, Kōta) is a former academy student of Konohagakure.

description.text: Kōtarō Fūma (風魔コウタロウ, Fūma Kōtarō) is a shinobi from Konohagakure and the captain of the Konoha Military Police.
Kōza Kubisaki (首崎講座, Kubisaki Kōza) was the leader of the Land of the Neck.
Kū (空, Kū) was a Fabricated created as a partial clone of Ōnoki.
Kūi Dōtonbori (道噸堀クーイ, Dōtonbori Kūi) is a competitive eater and member of Exploding Until You Eat.
Lando (ランド, Rando) is a young citizen of Tonika Town.
description.html: Lando (ランド, Rando) is a young citizen of the Tonika Village.

description.text: Lars Alexandersson (ラース アレクサンダーソン, Rasu Arekusandāson) is a bonus, playable character in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2.
Leo (レオ, Reo) is a young citizen of Tonika Village , Miina's brother and one of the survivors of the attack on their village.
description.html: Leo (レオ, Reo) is a young citizen of the Tonika Village.

description.text: The Daimyō of the Lightning Country is the leader of the Lightning Country.
description.html: He is the former daimyō of the Land of Lightning.

description.text: Lily Himeno (姫野リリ, Himeono Riri) is a popular idol of the Land of Fire.
description.html: Lily Himeno (姫野リリ, Himeono Riri) is a popular idol of the Land of Fire.

description.text: The Lion Turtle is an animal that was summoned by Ni in the film Naruto Shippūden the Movie: Heirs of the Will of Fire to help him in his fight against Kiba Inuzuka, Shino Aburame, and Hinata Hyūga.
description.html: This lion-turtle was the personal summon of Ni who appears in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire.

description.text: Log (ログ, Rogu) is a synthetic human created as a clone of Orochimaru, also serving as his son and Mitsuki's clone older brother.
Mabo is a student at Konohagakure Academy who appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4.
description.html: Mabo is an academy student of Konohagakure who appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4.

description.text: Mabui (マブイ, Mabui) was a kunoichi of Kumogakure and the personal assistant of the Fourth Raikage.
Madame Shijimi (マダム・しじみ, Madamu Shijimi) is the wife of the Daimyo of the Fire Country.
description.html: Madam Shijimi (マダム・しじみ, Madamu Shijimi) is the wife of the daimyō of the Land of Fire. Team Kakashi in Part I and Team Ebisu in Part II are assigned to find her lost cat, Tora, soon after becoming genin.

description.text: Madara Uchiha (うちはマダラ, Uchiha Madara) was a legendary shinobi, co-founder of Konoha and leader of the Uchiha Clan during his time. Furthermore, he was the past Reincarnation of Indra Ōtsutsuki. He was then revived in the Fourth Shinobi World War to fight the Great Shinobi Alliance, revealing his true intentions, making him the main antagonist of the series. Madara managed to capture the nine Tailed Beasts, seal them in the Demonic Statue of the Outer Path, and thus become the third and final Jinchūriki of the Ten-Tails.
Maen Nara (奈良マエン, Nara Maen) is a shinobi from Konohagakure, a member of the Nara Clan. He was part of the Great Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Magire (マギレ, Magire) is an ANBU from Konohagakure who is also a Medical Ninja.
Magire Kakuremino (隠蓑マギレ, Kakuremino Magire) is a student at Konohagakure Academy.
Mahiru (マヒル, Mahiru) was a ninja from Iwagakure who participated in the Third Shinobi World War.
Mai Kagetsu is the daughter of Tōbei Kagetsu and the youngest of Fūta Kagetsu's sisters.
description.html: Mai Kagetsu (花月舞, Kagetsu Mai) is an medicinal herb saleswoman and the youngest daughter of Tōbei Kagetsu.

description.text: Makaro Akimichi (秋道マカロ, Akimichi Makaro) is a Konohagakure Chūnin member of the Clan Akimichi.
Maki (マキ, Maki) is a kunoichi from Sunagakure who was trained by Pakura and was a member of the Third Division during the Fourth Great Shinobi World War.
Makinami Senka (撰歌巻波, Senka Makinami) is a Genin of Kirigakure and the youngest of the triplet brothers.
Makino (マキノ) is the film director who directed the Yukie Fujikaze films .
description.html: Makino (マキノ, Makino) is the film director that directed Yukie Fujikaze's movies.

description.text: Malice (マリス, Marisu) was a kunoichi and the main antagonist who appeared in the video game Naruto Shippūden 3D: The New Era.
Mamushi (マムシ, Mamushi ) is a shinobi from Sunagakure who teams with Saya and Sana.
Manabu Akado (赤門マナブ, Akado Manabu) is a genin-ranked ninja from Konohagakure.
description.html: Manabu Akado (赤門マナブ, Akado Manabu) is a genin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Manda (マンダ, Manda) was the largest snake and Orochimaru's ultimate summon.

Manda II (二代目マンダ, Nidaime Manda) is a snake created by Kabuto Yakushi from the skin cells of the original Manda. as well as Suigetsu Hōzuki's older brother. He was part of the previous generation of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist.

Mangetsu Hōzuki (鬼灯満月, Hōzuki Mangetsu) fue un shinobi de Kirigakure miembro del Clan Hōzuki, así como el hermano mayor de Suigetsu Hōzuki. Formó parte de la anterior generación de los Siete Espadachines Ninja de la Niebla.
Maroi (マロイ, Maroi) is one of the characters that appears in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison belonging to the village of Kumogakure. .
description.html: Maroi (マロイ, Maroi) is a Kumogakure shinobi who appears in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison. He was tasked with infiltrating the Hōzuki Castle as a prisoner, find the Box of Ultimate Bliss and to retrieve it for the village.

description.text: Maruten Akimichi (秋道マルテン, Akimichi Maruten) is one of the members of the Akimichi Clan.
Masako (マサコ) is a character who lives in Rōran.
description.html: Masako (マサコ, Masako) is a citizen of Rōran.

description.text: Mashō (魔焼) was the leader of Ceramic Village.
description.html: Mashō (魔焼) was the leader of Ceramic Village.

description.text: The Master Puppet was the definitive puppet of the Shirogane Clan, which appeared in the video game Naruto: Uzumaki Chronicles 2 .
description.html: The Master Puppet was the ultimate puppet of the Shirogane clan that appeared in Naruto: Uzumaki Chronicles 2.

description.text: Matatabi (又旅, Matatabi) known as the Two-Tails (ニ尾, Nibi) is a Tailed Beast that was sealed in Yugito Nii of Kumogakure. Matatabi was captured by Hidan and Kakuzu and sealed by Akatsuki, he was then freed by the Great Shinobi Alliance, however, he was re-captured by Madara Uchiha. He is currently free after the defeat and subsequent sealing of Kaguya.
Matsu (松, Matsu) is an exclusive character from the Naruto manga, he was hired by Teuchi along with Nishi to be one from Ichiraku Ramen's helpers while Ayame was away.
Matsuba (松葉, Matsuba) is a resident of the Green Rice Field.
description.html: Matsuba (松葉, Matsuba) is a villager of Green Banks.

description.text: Matsuri (マツリ, Matsuri) is a kunoichi from Sunagakure, she was part of the Fourth Division in the Fourth Shinobi World War and has always had a great appreciation for her teacher, Gaara.
Matsuri (マツリ, Matsuri) is a rank kunoichi Konoha genin.
description.html: Matsuri (マツリ, Matsuri) is a former academy student of Konohagakure.

description.text: Mawashi Dokuraku (独楽マワシ, Dokuraku Mawashi) is a shinobi from Konohagakure who is part of the Konoha Interrogation and Torture Force.
Mebuki Haruno (春野メブキ, Haruno Mebuki) is a kunoichi from Konohagakure. She is the mother of Sakura Haruno and wife of Kizashi Haruno. He is also a member of the Allied Mother Force.

Mecha-Kurama (メカ九喇嘛, Meka-Kurama) is a mechanized replica of Kurama that appears exclusively in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolution, within which is the awakened form of Mecha-Naruto. However, in their anime special both are different characters.
Mecha-Naruto (メカナルト, Meka-Naruto) is a mechanized replica of Naruto Uzumaki that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolution.

Mei Terumī (照美メイ, Terumī Mei) is a resident of Kirigakure and the retired Fifth Mizukage (五代目水影, Godaime Mizukage, literally 'Fifth Shadow of Water'). She became Mizukage after the terrible reign of Yagura Karatachi (Obito Uchiha). He was the leader of the Daimyō Protection Division of the Grand Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Meizu (冥头, Meizu) is a renegade ninja, former Chūnin of Kirigakure and, along with his older twin brother Gōzu, are known as the Devil Brothers.
Menma (メンマ, Menma) was a former member of a group of bandits originating from the Country of Rice Fields.
Menma Namikaze (波風メンマ, Namikaze Menma) is the son of Minato Namikaze and Kushina Uzumaki in Tenten's dream.

Menma Uzumaki (うずまきメンマ, Uzumaki Menma) is a character who appears in Road to Ninja: Naruto the Movie, he is the son of Kushina Uzumaki and Minato Namikaze in the alternate universe of Konoha, making him the 'Naruto Uzumaki' of that world. Like his counterpart, he is the Jinchūriki of the Dark Nine-Tails (黒九尾, Kuro Kyūbi).
Menō (メノウ, Menō) was a member of the Shirogane Clan, who appeared in Naruto: Uzumaki Chronicles. 2.
The Messenger Lizard was a messenger animal from Kumogakure.
description.html: This lizard was a messenger from Kumogakure.

description.text: Metal Lee (メタル・リー, Metaru Rī) is a Genin of Konohagakure, son of Rock Lee . He is part of Team 5, alongside Iwabee Yuino and Denki Kaminarimon.
Metoro Konjiki (金色メトロ, Konjiki Metoro) was a terrorist from Ishigakure and twin brother of Etoro Konjiki. Metoro along with his brother specialized in the destruction of buildings and merchant ships.
Mezu (メズ, Mezu) was an ANBU from Konohagakure who was part of Root.
description.html: Mezu (メズ, Mezu) was a member of Konohagakure's Anbu factionRoot, led by Danzō Shimura.

description.text: Mibuna (ミブナ, Mibuna) is a Student at Konohagakure Academy.
description.html: Mibuna (ミブナ, Mibuna) is an Academy Student from Konohagakure.

description.text: Michiru Tsuki (ツキミチル, Tsuki Michiru) is the current king of Moon Island Tsuki no Kuni
Michizō Manaka (間中道蔵, Manaka Michizō) is a bandit from the Land of Stone.
Michy appears in the film Naruto the Movie: The Rescue of the Princess of Snow!. He is a popular actor who plays Sukeakuro in the movie 'Blizzard Princess'.
description.html: Michy (Michy) is an actor that appears in Naruto the Movie: Ninja Clash in the Land of Snow.

description.text: Midare (ミダレ, Midare) was a genin who participated in the Chūnin Exams along with his team, Team Shigure.
Midnight Blade (黑夜之刃) is a ninja from Konohagakure and one of the playable characters in Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Online.
Midori (ミドリ, Midori) was a chūnin from Kusagakure.
description.html: Midori (ミドリ, Midori) was a chūnin from Kusagakure.

description.text: Midori (ミドリ, Midori) is a Konohagakure genin who appears in the story mode of Ultimate Ninja Storm 2.
description.html: Midori (ミドリ, Midori) is a genin of Konohagakure that appears in the story mode of Ultimate Ninja Storm 2.

description.text: Mifune (ミフネ, Mifune) is a samurai warrior and the General (大将, Taishō) from the Country of Iron. During the Fourth World War Shinobi was the captain of the Fifth Division of the Allied Shinobi Forces.
Migaki (ミガキ, Migaki) is a Konoha Medical Ninja in charge of rounds and monitoring the patients after surgery at the hospital.
description.html: Migaki (ミガキ, Migaki) is a medical-nin from Konohagakure. He is in charge of rounds and monitoring post-surgery patients at the hospital.

description.text: Might Duy (マイト・ダイ, Maito Dai) was a genin of Konoha and father of Might Guy. He was known by the nickname 'The Eternal Genin' (万年下忍, Mannen Genin) among the inhabitants of Konohagakure.
Might Guy (マイト・ガイ, Maito Gai) is a jōnin-level Shinobi from Konohagakure. He is the leader of Team Guy, composed of Neji Hyūga, Rock Lee and Tenten.
Miina (ミィナ, Miina) is a young villager from Tonika Village, sister of Leo and one of the survivors of the attack on their village.
description.html: Miina (ミィナ, Miina) is a young citizen of the Tonika Village.

description.text: Mijin (ミジン, Mijin) is a Genin from Sunagakure who teams up with Sajin and Mujin.
description.html: Mijin (ミジン , Mijin) is a shinobi from Sunagakure and a teammate of Sajin and Mujin.

description.text: Mikazuki (ミカヅキ, Mikazuki) is a stray cat who became Mitsuki's wandering pet.
description.html: Mikazuki (ミカヅキ, Mikazuki) is a stray kitten that became the wandering pet of Mitsuki.

description.text: Mikoshi (ミコシ, Mikoshi) is a genin from Sunagakure who teams with Matsuri and Yukata.
description.html: Mikoshi (ミコシ, Mikoshi) is a genin from Sunagakure. He is part of a genin group alongside Matsuri and Yukata.

description.text: Mikoto Uchiha (うちはミコト, Uchiha Mikoto) was the wife of Fugaku Uchiha and the mother of Itachi Uchiha and Sasuke Uchiha.
description.html: Mikoto Uchiha (うちはミコト, Uchiha Mikoto) was a jōnin from Konohagakure's Uchiha clan.

description.text: Minato Namikaze (波風ミナト, Namikaze Minato), also known as The Yellow Flash of Konoha (木ノ葉の黄色い閃光, Konoha no Kiiroi Senkō), was the Fourth Hokage (四代目火影, Yondaime Hokage) of the Hidden Leaf Village. He was a disciple of Jiraiya and teacher of Kakashi Hatake, Obito Uchiha and Rin Nohara. He was also the husband of Kushina Uzumaki and the father of Naruto Uzumaki. Additionally, he was the first Jinchūriki of Kurama's Yin half. He was resurrected by Orochimaru in the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Minoichi (ミノイチ, Minoichi) was an ANBU of Konohagakure until he became a renegade ninja. After this, he went to the Country of Silence where he joined the Enlightened Ones under the orders of Gengo.
description.html: Minoichi (ミノイチ, Minoichi) was a Konohagakure Anbu until he became a missing-nin and joined the Land of Silence.

description.text: Minoji (ミノジ, Minoji) is a genin-level ninja from Konohagakure who participated in the last Chūnin Exams .
description.html: Minoji (ミノジ, Minoji) is a genin from Konohagakure.

description.text: Mirai Sarutobi (猿飛ミライ, Sarutobi Mirai) is a Konohagakure kunoichi belonging to the Sarutobi clan.
Miroku (弥勒, Miroku) was the best priestess of the Country of Demons and mother of Shion.
Miru (美瑠, Miru) was a Kunoichi from Kirigakure who belonged to the Code Division and who was attracted to the Akatsuki, Kisame Hoshigaki.
description.html: Miru (美瑠, Miru) was a kunoichi from Kirigakure and a part of the village's Cypher Division.

description.text: Misumi Tsurugi (剣ミスミ, Tsurugi Misumi) is a Konoha Genin who participates in the Chūnin Exams in the first season. He was secretly a subordinate of Orochimaru.
Misuno (ミスノ, Misuno) is a Kunoichi from Kirigakure who serves as an escort to the Sixth Mizukage Chōjūrō.
description.html: Misuno (ミスノ, Misuno) is a kunoichi of Kirigakure.

description.text: Mitate (ミタテ, Mitate) is a medical ninja from Konohagakure.

Mito Uzumaki (うずまき水戸, Uzumaki Mito) was a kunoichi from the Whirlpool Country. She was Kurama's first Jinchūriki. Additionally, she was the wife of Hashirama Senju and grandmother of Nawaki and Tsunade.
Mitoku (ミトク, Mitoku) is the current head of the Konoha Cryptanalysis Squad who oversees the day-to-day activities of the team. , taking direct orders from the Hokage.
description.html: Mitoku (ミトク, Mitoku) is the current head of the Konoha Cryptanalysis Team and oversees the day-to-day activities of the division, taking direct orders from the Hokage.

description.text: Mitsuki (ミツキ, Mitsuki) is a synthetic human created as a clone of Orochimaru, and treated as one of his children. To confirm whether or not Boruto Uzumaki was his sunshine, he emigrated to Konohagakure where he entered and graduated from the Academy, eventually becoming a member of Team Konohamaru alongside Sarada Uchiha and Boruto.
Mitsuo (ミツオ, Mitsuo ) was a thief and the second follower of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki.
description.html: Mitsuo (ミツオ, Mitsuo) was a former thief and a follower of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki.

description.text: Mizore Fukuyuma (冬熊ミゾレ, Fuyukuma Mizore) was a ninja from the Hidden Snow Village, who appears in the first Naruto feature film. : Naruto The Movie: The Rescue of the Snow Princess. Where he is part of the group of antagonists. The main characteristics of him are: the large size of him compared to his peers and the peculiar features of him.
Mizuki (ミズキ, Mizuki) is a childhood friend of Iruka Umino and a former classmate at the Ninja Academy. He later becomes the first antagonist of the series.
Mizunoe (壬) is a former member of the Anbu Root faction of Konohagakure.
Mizunoto (癸) is a former member of the Anbu Root faction of Konohagakure.
Mizura (ミヅラ, Mizura) is a genin from the Hidden Star Village and is a friend of Hokuto and Sumaru
description.html: Mizura (ミヅラ, Mizura) is a genin from Hoshigakure.

description.text: Mo (モー, Mo) is a shinobi from Kemurigakure belonging to the Moya Brothers.
description.html: Mo (モ, Mo) is a member of the Moya Triad.

description.text: Moegi Kazamatsuri (風祭モエギ, Kazamatsuri Moegi) is a kunoichi from Konohagakure. During her youth she was part of Team Ebisu. She is the leader of Team Moegi, made up of Shikadai, Chōchō and Inojin.
Moguranmaru (モグランマル, Moguranmaru) was a giant mole who also served as Muyami's personal summon.
Mogusa (モグサ, Mogusa) is a medical ninja from Konohagakure.

Momiji (モミジ, Momiji) is a girl who likes French fries and strong people. She travels with the peddlers Haruna was hiding with. Her grandmother taught her how to find water, and she is a very easy person to bribe.
description.html: Momiji (モミジ, Momiji) is a young girl from the Land of Vegetables.

description.text: Momiji (モミジ, Momiji) is a hostess at Tanzaku Barracks. She works with the equally beautiful Susuki, but Momiji feels he has a better fashion sense.
description.html: Momiji (モミジ, Momiji) works in Tanzaku Quarters.

description.text: Momo (モモ, Momo) is a young bully affiliated with the River Country and Sasami's older twin brother.
description.html: Momo (モモ, Momo) is an unknown assailant, who is affiliated to the Land of Rivers.

description.text: Momo (もも, Momo) is one of the many ninneko who live in Sora-ku, and is Tamaki's companion.

Momoshiki Ōtsutsuki (大筒木モモシキ, Ōtsutsuki Momoshiki) was a member of the main family of the Ōtsutsuki Clan, who traveled in search of Chakra in order to gain power and longevity. After his death at the hands of Boruto Uzumaki, Momoshiki chose him as his vessel by granting him a Karma.
Mondai (モンダイ, Mondai) was a spy who wanted to infiltrate the Leaf Village along with his companion Potcha, posing as Guy.
Monga (モンガ, Monga) was a shinobi from Iwagakure who participated in the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Monju (文殊, Monju) was a member of a group known as Shinobazu. He was defeated by Naruto Uzumaki and later killed by Rock Lee's Whirlpool Blade Technique.
Monkey King: Enma (猿猴王・猿魔, Enkōō: Enma) is the personal summoning of Hiruzen Sarutobi. Apparently, they were battle companions for a long time, which explains their advanced age.
Monzaemon Chikamatsu (近松モンザエモン, Monzaemon Chikamatsu) was the creator of the puppeteer technique, although not of the puppets themselves.
Morio (モリオ, Morio) is a chūnin-ranked shinobi of Iwagakure.
description.html: Morio (モリオ, Morio) is an Iwagakure shinobi.

description.text: Moroi (モロイ, Moroi) is a shinobi of Kumogakure. He is the leader of the Great Shinobi Alliance's Barrier Team during the Fourth Great Shinobi World War.
description.html: Moroi (モロイ, Moroi) is a shinobi from Kumogakure, and the Captain (班長, hanchō) of the Kumo Barrier Team.

description.text: Motoi (モトイ, Motoi) is an old friend of Killer B and the Kumogakure ninja caretaker of the Turtle Island. He took Naruto and Yamato to the places where Killer B learned how to handle the Giant Eight-Tailed Ox.
Mozuku (モズク, Mozuku) is a Chūnin-level ninja from Konoha. He is a member of the Konoha Interrogation and Torture Force.
Mozuku (モズク, Mozuku) is the alleged leader of the Mokuzu Island Gang who tried to loot Naruto's ship.
description.html: Mozuku (モズク, Mozuku) is presumably the leader of the gang of the Mokuzu Island.

description.text: Mubi (夢火, Mubi) is a genin from Amegakure who first appears during the Chūnin Exams.
Mugino (ムギノ, Mugino) was a shinobi from Konohagakure.

Mui (无为, Mui) was the main antagonist of Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison. He was the master (主, aruji) of the Hōzukijō prison, and is also the one who used the maximum prison technique to drain the powers of his prisoners.
Mujin (ムジン, Mujin) is a Genin from Sunagakure who teams up with Sajin and Mijin.
description.html: Mujin (ムジン, Mujin) is a shinobi from Sunagakure and a teammate of Sajin and Mijin.

description.text: Mukade (ムカデ, Mukade) was a Jōnin of Sunagakure and Sasori's subordinate for the organization, Akatsuki.
description.html: Mukade (ムカデ, Mukade) was a jōnin from Sunagakure who left Suna and became a servant of Akatsuki member Sasori.

description.text: Mukade (ムカデ, Mukade) was the main antagonist of Naruto Shippūden 4: The Lost Tower.
Mukai Kohinata (小日向ムカイ, Kohinata Mukai) was an alleged spy for Kirigakure, serving as Jōnin and ANBU of Konohagakure. Mukai came from a family distantly related to the Hyūga Clan.
Muku (無垢, Muku) is a shinobi of Kusagakure and son of Mui. This character appeared in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison.
Murakumo Kurama (鞍馬ムラクモ, Kurama Murakumo) was the head of the main branch of the Kurama Clan. He was also the husband of Uroko Kurama and the father of Yakumo Kurama.
description.html: Murakumo Kurama (鞍馬ムラクモ, Kurama Murakumo) was a jōnin of Konohagakure and head of the main branch of the Kurama clan.

description.text: Murasame (ムラサメ, Murasame) is a renegade ninja from Amegakure in the second Naruto OVA.
Musai (ムサイ, Musai) is a ninja who teamed up with a Sunagakure shinobi during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
description.html: Musai (ムサイ, Musai) is a Kumogakure shinobi.

description.text: Muta Aburame (油女ムタ, Aburame Muta) was a chosen Konohagakure shinobi for his abilities to be part of the Reconnaissance and Infiltration Squad under the command of Anko Mitarashi and collect information on the enemy for the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Muyami (ムヤミ, Muyami) is a Genin of Kusagakure, who teams up with Kazami and Burami.
Mōryō (魍魉, Mōryō) was a demon from another world who wants to form an empire that lasts a thousand years with his Ghostly Army and is also the main antagonist of Naruto Shippūden: The Movie.
description.html: Mōryō (魍魎, Mōryō) was a large, dark demon from another world that appeared in Naruto Shippūden the Movie.

description.text: Mū (無, Mū) was the Second Tsuchikage (二代目土影, Nidaime Tsuchikage; meaning 'Second Shadow of Earth') of Iwagakure. He was revived by Kabuto Yakushi to participate in the Fourth Shinobi World War on Akatsuki's side.
Nadare Rōga (狼牙ナダレ, Rōga Nadare) was a shinobi of Yukigakure who worked under Dotō Kazahana. and was a teammate of Fubuki Kakuyoku and Mizore Fuyukuma.
Nae (ナエ, Nae) is a tourist from Sunagakure.
description.html: Nae (ナエ, Nae) is a tourist from Sunagakure.

description.text: Nagare (ナガレ) is a member of the Watari group under the service of Hōki. It is said that he obtained this ability after his stay in Otogakure, subjected to Orochimaru's experiments.

Nagato (長門, Nagato), better known as Pain (ペイン, Pein), was one of the most powerful shinobi, and the recognized leader of Akatsuki and Amegakure. All Akatsuki members referred to him as 'Leader', except Konan who called him by his name, Pain. He wore the Cero ring (零, Rei) on his right thumb. He was also a user of the legendary dōjutsu, the Rinnegan, which was given by Madara Uchiha before his death and implanted in Nagato when he was just a child. During her stay in the organization she worked with Konan and received orders from Obito from the shadows.
Naho (ナホ, Naho) is a relative of the Daimyō of the Fire Country.
description.html: Naho (ナホ, Naho) is a relative of the Fire Daimyō.

description.text: Naka Uchiha (うちはナカ, Uchiha Naka) was a Konohagakure ninja belonging to the Uchiha Clan.
Namida Suzumeno (雀乃なみだ, Suzumeno Namida) is a Genin of Konohagakure. He is part of Team 15 along with Sumire Kakei and Wasabi Izuno.
Nan (ナン, Nan) is the leader of a village in the Country of Rice Fields and is Ran's brother.
Nanafushi (ナナフシ, Nanafushi) is a ninja from the Land of Valleys.
description.html: Nanafushi (ナナフシ, Nanafushi) is a ninja from the Land of Valleys.

description.text: Nangō (ナンゴウ, Nangō) was a member of Team Magaki, tasked with stealing the Kinjutsu of the Tsuchigumo Clan. unknown town.
Naori Uchiha (うちはナオリ, Uchiha Naori) fue una kunoichi de Konohagakure perteneciente al clan Uchiha.
Este hombre era un sacerdote de un pueblo desconocido.
Naruto Musasabi is a fictional character created by Jiraiya from the novel The Story of an Absolutely Bold Shinobi written by Jiraiya.
description.html: Naruto Musasabi is a fictional character in service to Shuku Village from The Tale of the Utterly Gutsy Shinobi novel written by Jiraiya. He is featured as the novel's main character alongside his partner Tsuyu, who is also written as his primary love interest. Inspired by Nagato, the character is Naruto Uzumaki's namesake.

description.text: Naruto Uzumaki (うずまきナルト, Uzumaki Naruto) is the protagonist of the manga and anime series Naruto and Naruto Shippūden. He is also a participant in the manga and anime Boruto: Naruto Next Generations, a sequel to the original work by Masashi Kishimoto. He is a resident of Konohagakure, son of the Fourth Hokage, Minato Namikaze and his wife Kushina Uzumaki, as well as being the current reincarnation of Asura Ōtsutsuki.
Natori (ナトリ, Natori) is a Chūnin-level ninja from Konoha who works at the Konoha Birdyard.
description.html: Natori (ナトリ, Natori) is a chūnin of Konohagakure that works in the Konoha Aviary.

description.text: Natsu (ナツ, Natsu) is a ninja from Iwagakure who was part of the Second Division of the Great Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
description.html: Natsu (ナツ, Natsu) is a shinobi from Iwagakure.

description.text: Natsu Hyūga (日向ナツ, Hyūga Natsu) is a resident of Konohagakure and a member of the Hyūga Clan.
description.html: Natsu Hyūga (日向ナツ, Hyūga Natsu) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure's Hyūga clan.

description.text: Natsuhi (ナツヒ, Natsuhi) was a jōnin-ranked kunoichi of the Hidden Star Village and Hotarubi's wife and Sumaru's mother.
Nauma (ナウマ, Nauma) was once a member of the 12 Ninja Guardians.
Nawaki (縄樹, Nawaki) was Tsunade's little brother, grandson of the First Hokage and was a Genin of Konohagakure.
description.html: Nawaki (縄樹, Nawaki) was a genin from Konohagakure's Senju clan.

description.text: Nazuna (ナズナ) is the granddaughter of the village chief Hinoki from Naruto: Path of the Ninja 2.
description.html: Nazuna (ナズナ, Nazuna) is the granddaughter of the village head Hinoki from Naruto: Path of the Ninja 2.

description.text: Neji Hyūga (日向ネジ, Hyūga Neji) was a Jōnin of Konohagakure, a member of Team Guy along with his companions Rock Lee and Tenten. He belonged to the Hyūga Clan, one of the most powerful in Konoha for possessing one of the three famous Dōjutsu, the Byakugan. In the Fourth World War Shinobi was part of the Second Division.
Nejiri (ネジリ, Nejiri) is a genin-ranked ninja from Sunagakure.

Nekobaa (猫バア, Nekobaa (literally 'Grandma Cat')) is an old woman who lives in an abandoned city along with her granddaughter, Tamaki. She runs a supply store that the Uchiha Clan used to use. She lives with many cats, including talkers like Denka and Hina.
description.html: Nekobaa (猫バア, Nekobaa, English TV: Granny Cat, Literally meaning: Grandma Cat) is an old woman who lives in an abandoned city together with her granddaughter, Tamaki. She runs a supplies shop that the Uchiha clan used to use. She lives with lots of cats, including talking ones such as Denka and Hina.

description.text: Nekomata (猫又, Nekomata) is a giant cat who is the leader of the Ninja Cat household.
Nemui (眠い, Nemui) is a genin from Kumogakure.
Nerugui is a ferret who appears in the Naruto Movie 2: The Illusory Ruins Deep in the Earth.
Nezumi Kaitō (ねずみ, Nezumi Kaitō) is an inhabitant of Konohagakure and is also a thief who steals jewels.
description.html: Nezumi Kaitō (怪盗ネズミ, Kaitō Nezumi) is a jewel thief.

description.text: Ni (ニ, Ni) was an antagonist of Naruto Shippūden the Movie: Inheritors of the Will of Fire. She was a kunoichi follower of Hiruko, along with Ichi and San.
These special Ninken are companions of the kunoichi Ni. They make their appearance in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: Inheritors of the Will of Fire.
description.html: They both possess two spear-like weapons on their backs that they can launch out to attack the enemy. These spear-like weapons move extremely fast and are durable enough to withstand one of Kakashi's Lightning Cutters head on without any apparent damage.

description.text: Nigai (苦い, Nigai) was a ninja belonging to Kumogakure.

The Nine-Tails Naruto Clone (九尾化したナルトのクローン, Kyūbi kashita Naruto no Kurōn) is a being that was created from the Kabuto snakes that Naruto consumed, which They gave rise to a clone of Naruto with Kurama's chakra.
Ningame (忍亀, Ningame - literally 'ninja turtle') is Might Guy's personal summon who usually looks after Rock Lee's safety. when his master is not around.
description.html: Ningame (忍亀, Ningame, Literally meaning: Ninja Tortoise) is Might Guy's personal summon.

description.text: Nishi (西, Nishi) is a character exclusive to the Naruto manga. He was hired by Teuchi along with Matsu to be one of Ichiraku Ramen's assistants while Ayame was away.
Nitora Take (武にとら, Take Nitora) is a resident of Konohagakure.
description.html: Nitora Take (武にとら, Take Nitora) is an academy student of Konohagakure.

description.text: Nobori (ノボリ, Nobori) was in Konohamaru's class at the Konohagakure Ninja Academy.
description.html: Nobori (ノボリ, Nobori) is a former academy student of Konohagakure.

description.text: Noji was a villager from Takigakure. Died in a landslide caused by Team Suien.
description.html: Noji was a villager of Takigakure. He was killed in a landslide caused by Team Suien.

description.text: Nonota (ノノタ, Nonota) is a ninja who teamed up with Musai during the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Nonō Yakushi (薬師ノノウ, Yakushi Nonou) was a young nun who helped run an orphanage. In her previous life, Nonō was the best Root Intelligence Shinobi in Konoha.
Fūshin (風心, Fūshin) is a Rogue Ninja who was the leader of the Lightning Group. After the group's dissolution, Fūshin posed as a shinobi from the Hot Spring Country named Nowaki (野分, Nowaki).

Nue (鵺, Nue) is a yōkai created by Raíz. He is the result of the Gozu Tennō project, designed to be the ultimate weapon harvested from Hashirama Senju's cells. Originally, the project was headed by Tanuki Shigaraki, who passed it on to his daughter Sumire Kakei with the intention of wreaking havoc on Konohagakure.
Nurari (濡羅吏, Nurari) was a servant of Orochimaru and member of the mission to capture Isobu. Although he has a delicate appearance, he is actually a very difficult opponent.
Nurui (ヌルイ, Nurui) is a Chūnin-level shinobi who comes from Kumogakure.
description.html: Nurui (ヌルイ, Nurui) is a shinobi of Kumogakure.

description.text: Obito Uchiha (うちはオビト, Uchiha Obito) was a partner of Kakashi Hatake and Rin Nohara, a student of Minato Namikaze and was the one who gave Kakashi his left Sharingan. After his supposed death in the Third Shinobi World War, he reappeared as Tobi (トビ, Tobi). He was the true leader of Akatsuki after the death of the original leader, Yahiko. He was one of the main antagonists of the series, until his defeat at the hands of the Shinobi Alliance and his redemption at the hands of Naruto Uzumaki. He had proclaimed himself as Madara Uchiha to strike fear into his opponents. In addition to this, she was the second Jinchūriki of the Ten-Tails.
She was a member of the Uchiha clan of Konohagakure.
description.html: She was a member of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan.

description.text: Oboro (朧, Oboro) is a Genin of Amegakure. , member of Team Oboro.
Okami is the hostess of an inn located in the Country of Fire.
description.html: Okami (女将, Okami) is a hostess who works at an inn in the Land of Fire.

description.text: Okisuke (オキスケ, Okisuke) is a samurai who, along with to Urakaku, he was Mifune's bodyguard at the Meeting of the Five Kages.
Oko (オコ, Oko) is a member of the Byakuya Group.
Okyō (お京, Okyō) is a girl from Konohagakure.
description.html: Okyō (お京, Okyō) goes to the same river where Naruto trains to learn the Summoning Technique. Jiraiya spends more time watching Okyō frolicking with her friends than he does watching Naruto.

description.text: Omoi (オモイ Omoi) is a shinobi from Kumogakure. He was Killer B's apprentice and a member of Team Samui. He was part of the Surprise Attack Division during the Fourth Shinobi World War. He currently works as the Fifth Raikage's escort.
The Onbu (オンブ, Onbu) was a child onbaa who was taken from his nest by a falcon.
description.html: Onbu (オンブ, Onbu) was an infant onbaa that was taken from its nest by a hawk and it was dropped on Naruto's back and thought he was its mother.

description.text: Orochimaru (大蛇丸, Orochimaru) is a veteran shinobi of Konohagakure, a member of Team Hiruzen and one of the legendary Sannin, along with his companions Jiraiya and Tsunade. He was a member of the Root organization under the leadership of Danzō and subsequently defected from the village after being discovered doing experiments on the villagers, in addition to being a former member of Akatsuki. He wore the 'Empty' ring (空, Kū) on his left little finger. He was one of the main antagonists of the series until his demise at the hands of Sasuke Uchiha. During the Fourth World War Shinobi was revived by his ward.

Osoi (オソイ, Osoi) was a shinobi of Kumogakure, father of Musai and former partner of Toroi. He was revived by Orochimaru believing him to be Toroi. Later, it is reused by Kabuto Yakushi in the face of the Fourth Shinobi World War.
description.html: Osoi (オソイ, Osoi) was a genin from Kumogakure. He was the father of Musai.

description.text: Otoha (オトハ, Otoha) is a nurse who works at the Konoha Hospital.
description.html: Otoha (オトハ, Otoha) is a nurse from Konohagakure who works at the Konoha Hospital.

description.text: Otokaze (オトカゼ, Otokaze) is a jōnin-ranked ninja from Sunagakure.
description.html: Otokaze (オトカゼ, Otokaze) is a jōnin of Sunagakure.

description.text: Oyone (オヨネ, Oyone) is a Medical Ninja and a researcher from Konoha.
description.html: Oyone (オヨネ, Oyone) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure and a member of the village's Analysis Team in the Intelligence Division.

description.text: Pakkun (パックン, Pakkun) is a small lapdog, and the smallest of Kakashi's eight ninken.
Pakura (パクラ, Pakura) was a famous kunoichi of Sunagakure. She was resurrected by Kabuto Yakushi in order to fight in the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Pochi (ポチ, Pochi) was Inari's dog, and later Akane's dog.
Ponta (ポン太) is a raccoon and the companion of the enka music teacher, Sabu.
description.html: Ponta (ポン太, Ponta) is a giant raccoon and the companion of the master enka music ninja, Sabu.

description.text: Poochie is a pet dog of Konohagakure who appears in the 'Road to Boruto' DLC from Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4.
description.html: Poochie is a pet dog from Konohagakure that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4's "Road to Boruto" DLC.

description.text: Potcha (ポッチャ, Potcha) was a spy who wanted to infiltrate the Leaf Village along with his partner Mondai, posing as Lee.
This man was a shinobi and a farmer from Kusagakure.
Rahyō (羅氷, Rahyō) was a renegade ninja from Kirigakure and a prominent member of the Ryūha Armament Alliance.
Rai Uchiha (うちはライ, Uchiha Rai) was a shinobi of Konohagakure belonging to the Uchiha Clan.

Raidō Namiashi (並足ライドウ, Namiashi Raidō) acts as the Third Hokage's bodyguard and assistant during the Chūnin Exams, and is characterized by a large scar on his left cheek. He is usually seen with Genma Shiranui and Aoba Yamashiro. He is known in Konoha as the prominent 'master assassin.'

Raiga Kurosuki (黒鋤雷牙, Kurosuki Raiga) was a Jōnin of Kirigakure and a former member of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. . In the anime he was part of ANBU, in addition to being a founder and member of the Kurosuki Family.
Raijin (雷神, Raijin) and his brother Fujin are known as the Legendary Stupid Brothers.
description.html: Raijin (雷神, Raijin) and his brother Fūjin are the Legendary Stupid Brothers.

description.text: Raimei (ライメイ, Raimei) is a shinobi who has a contract with the Makibi Company to fight in the Colosseum.
Rainenmaru was one of Suien's summons that appeared in Naruto : Mission: Protect the waterfall village! (novel).
description.html: Rainenmaru was one of Suien's summons who appeared in Naruto: Mission: Protect The Waterfall Village! (novel).

description.text: Ran (乱, Ran) is a villager who lives in the Country of Rice Fields.
description.html: Ran (乱, Ran) is a villager who lives in the Land of Rice Fields.

description.text: Ran (ラン, Ran) is a Kumogakure kunoichi.
description.html: Ran (ラン, Ran) is a kunoichi of Kumogakure.

description.text: Ranka (ランカ, Ranka) is a ninja on Anko Mitarashi's team with a mission to find and investigate Tobi's hideout in Graveyard Mountain.
Ranke (ランケ, Ranke) served as one of Haido's Knights.
Ranmaru (兰丸 Ranmaru) is a young orphan from Kirigakure who was loyal to Raiga Kurosuki, a former member of the Seven Swordsmen of the Mist.

Rasa (羅砂, Rasa) was the Fourth Kazekage (四代目風影, Yondaime Kazekage literally means 'Fourth Wind Shadow') of Sunagakure and the father of Temari, Gaara, Kankurō and Karura's husband. He was revived by Kabuto Yakushi to fight in the Fourth Shinobi World War.
Rashii (ラシイ, Rashii) is a shinobi from Kumogakure who was part of the First Division of the Grand Shinobi Alliance during the Fourth Shinobi War. Shinobi World.
description.html: Rashii (ラシイ, Rashii) is a jōnin from Kumogakure.

description.text: Reishi Kodon (虎呑レイシ, Kodon Reishi) was a pharmacist of the Kodon clan.
Reki (レキ, Reki) is a shinobi from Sunagakure.
description.html: Reki (レキ, Reki) is a jōnin of Sunagakure.

description.text: Renga (連歌, Renga) is the leader of the Vegetable Country Criminal Brothers in the Vegetable Country saga.
Renga Kokubō (国防レンガ, Kokubō Renga) is a Genin from Konohagakure. He is part of Team 25 alongside Hōki Taketori and Hako Kuroi.

Renge Momoashi is a fictional character formerly in the service of Shuku Village from the novel The Tale of the Utterly Gutsy Shinobi written by Jiraiya . He appears as the main antagonist of the novel. He is described as coming from a clan of 'centipede users'.
description.html: Renge Momoashi is a fictional character formerly in service to Shuku Village from The Tale of the Utterly Gutsy Shinobi novel written by Jiraiya. He is featured as the novel's main antagonist. He is described as hailing from a clan of "centipede users".

description.text: Reto (烈斗, Reto) was the First Kazekage (初代風影, Shodai Kazekage; literally 'First Wind Shadow' ) and the founder of Sunagakure in the Land of Wind.
Riichi (リイチ, Riichi) is an employee of an inn in Shukuba City, although he has aspirations of owning his own hotel one day.
description.html: Riichi (リイチ, Riichi) works at an inn in Shukuba Town, though he has aspirations of someday owning his own hotel.

description.text: Riichi (リイチ, Riichi) is a Jōnin of Konohagakure.
description.html: Riichi (リイチ, Riichi) is a jōnin of Konohagakure.

description.text: Rikumaru (リク丸, Rikumaru) is one of the deer owned by the Nara Clan.
description.html: Rikumaru (リク丸, Rikumaru) is one of the Nara clan's deer.

description.text: Rin Nohara (のはらリン, Nohara Rin) was a chūnin-ranked kunoichi of Konoha. She was a medical ninja companion to Kakashi Hatake and Obito Uchiha under the command of Minato Namikaze. She was the Jinchūriki of Isobu before Yagura, the Fourth Mizukage.
